title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: 2 Deadly Shootings in 2 Days Highlight Israel’s Failure to Address Gaza’s Power Vacuum
items.description: Over the weekend, Israeli soldiers shot Palestinians near an Israeli-backed aid site and a U.N. convoy. Both episodes pointed to Israel’s refusal to a...

items.title: Israel Refuses to Renew Visa of Top UN Humanitarian Official for Gaza
items.description: The head of the agency that helps oversee international aid deliveries to the territory had criticized the impact of Israeli policy on civilians.

items.title: A Bangladesh Air Force training jet crashes into a Dhaka school, killing at least 19
items.description: The jet crashed into a school campus in the capital, Dhaka, shortly after takeoff on Monday.

items.title: A creek with atomic waste from WWII is linked to increased cancer risk
items.description: A new study in JAMA shows how proximity to Coldwater Creek, where nuclear waste from the Manhattan Project was improperly stored, affected cancer rate...

items.title: SkyWest Flight Aborts Landing to Avoid Midair Collision Near Military Base
items.description: After the passenger jet landed safely in North Dakota, the pilot told passengers that he had made an “aggressive maneuver” to avoid hitting a military...

items.title: Kenneth Colley, 87, ‘Star Wars’ Actor With a Commanding Presence, Dies
items.description: A fixture onscreen and onstage, he became a fan favorite as Darth Vader’s ally, Admiral Piett, in “The Empire Strikes Back” and “Return of the Jedi.”

items.title: The world keeps millions of vaccines on ice. Is it worth it?
items.description: It costs nearly $100 million a year to maintain global stockpiles of vaccines for Ebola, cholera, meningitis and yellow fever in case of emergency. A ...

items.title: COMIC: Exploring the ocean's wonderous, mysterious depths
items.description: Did you know that we know less about the sea than we do about space? With this comic, we explore some of what scientists do know about Earth's ocean.

items.title: Assad is gone. But can Syrians go home?
items.description: After over a decade in exile, many Syrians living abroad are contemplating what was once unthinkable: going home. But what does home look like today?

items.title: Conviction of Man in Killing of Etan Patz Is Overturned
items.description: Pedro Hernandez, a former bodega stock clerk, had confessed years after the 1979 crime to luring Etan Patz, 6, into a basement in SoHo. The case shook...

items.title: Seabed-Mining Firm Faces Legal Questions Over Trump Policy
items.description: After Trump pledged to open international waters to mining, The Metals Company sought U.S. permits. But other countries are raising legal concerns.
